3.19 Invoice Submission and Payment

(a) Upon Location Acceptance by Vendor, AT&T will receive two identical invoices related to the specified Cell Site. These invoices should align with the AT&T purchase order and outline the Material, Deliverables, and Services supplied for that particular Cell Site. The Vendor's invoice should clearly specify, where applicable:

   (i) Quantities of each Material, Deliverable, and Service item,
   (ii) Prices for each Material, Deliverable, and Service item,
   (iii) Tax status and tax amount per item, if applicable,
   (iv) Total costs for each item,
   (v) Total sales or use taxes,
   (vi) Any discounts offered,
   (vii) Shipping charges, if any,
   (viii) The total amount due,
   (ix) Remittance address,
  (x) Descriptions of the Material, Deliverables, and Services, and
  (xi) Any special service charges, if applicable.

Each invoice must clearly state that payment will be made according to the terms outlined in this Agreement, and all payments for the invoiced Material, Deliverables, and Services under the Build Addendum will adhere to the Structured Payments Schedule as detailed in Schedule 3 of the Build Addendum.

Upon receiving an invoice, AT&T will review it promptly. If AT&T does not dispute, in good faith, the amounts stated within the invoice, it will acknowledge that the Structured Payment as indicated in the invoice is due according to this Agreement and the Build Addendum. In case AT&T disputes any amounts stated in an invoice, it will provide written notice of the contested amounts to Vendor prior to the date of the first Structured Payment listed within the invoice.

Vendor will submit a payment request to AT&T on a monthly basis, commencing on the first day of each calendar month, for the Structured Payments as outlined in the Build Addendum and the Maintenance Fees as detailed in the Maintenance Addendum. AT&T must pay Vendor no later than sixty (60) days after receiving the monthly payment request for Structured Payments. For invoices related to Maintenance Fees, AT&T should provide written notice of any good faith dispute within ninety (90) days of receipt. Any dispute of a Maintenance Fees invoice must be made in good faith and include a detailed description of the contested amounts and reasons for the dispute. Despite any disputes, AT&T will pay all undisputed amounts in full to Vendor by the due date of the invoice.

Invoices submitted by Vendor more than one (1) year after the delivery of Materials and Deliverables or the provision of Services are considered late and AT&T is under no obligation to pay these invoices.
